questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel in the Arabian Peninsula is held to be the tallest building in the world, completed in 2010?
questions.context: This skyscraper, at over 828 meters tall, has redefined the Dubai skyline and features the highest observation deck in the world.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Southern Europe is renowned for its well-preserved Roman amphitheater, finished in 80 AD?
questions.context: This iconic structure once hosted gladiatorial contests and could hold up to 50,000 spectators.

questions.question: Identify the ancient ruin in Southeast Asia known for being a sprawling religious complex and the largest religious monument in the world.
questions.context: Constructed in the early 12th century, this temple was originally dedicated to the Hindu god Vishnu before becoming a Buddhist site.

questions.question: Which historical battle site in Western Europe was the location of a crucial victory in 1815, ending Napoleon's rule?
questions.context: This battle marked the end of the Napoleonic Wars and was Napoleon Bonaparte's final defeat.

questions.question: What is the famed museum in France known for housing the Mona Lisa and a vast collection of art spanning millennium?
questions.context: Once a royal palace, this museum is the world's most visited and features collections ranging from ancient civilizations to the 19th century.
